ui-icon.description: Material icons are delightful, beautifully crafted symbols for common actions and items.

ui-button.description: Buttons allow users to take actions, and make choices, with a single tap.

ui-fab.description: A floating action button (FAB) represents the primary action of a screen.

ui-icon-button.description: Icon buttons (Toggle buttons) allow users to take actions, and make choices, with a single tap.

ui-segmented-buttons.description: Segmented buttons allow users to toggle the selected states of grouped buttons.

ui-top-app-bar.description: The top app bar displays information and actions relating to the current screen.

ui-grid.description: Material designâ€™s responsive UI is based on a column-variate grid layout. It has 12 columns on desktop, 8 columns on tablet and 4 columns on phone.

ui-divider.description: A divider is a thin line that groups content in lists and layouts.

ui-drawer.description: Navigation drawers provide access to destinations in your app.

ui-drawer-header.description: Non-scrollable element that exists at the top of the drawer.

ui-drawer-title.description: Title text element of the drawer.

ui-drawer-subtitle.description: Subtitle text element of the drawer.

ui-drawer-content.description: Scrollable content area of the drawer.

ui-drawer-app-content.description: Mandatory for <ui-drawer type="dismissible"> only. Sibling element that is resized when the drawer opens/closes.

ui-tab-indicator.description: Contains the custom tab indicator content.

ui-tab-scroller.description: Contains the custom tab scroller content.

ui-menu-anchor.description: Used to indicate which element the menu should be anchored to.

ui-menu.description: Menus display a list of choices on temporary surfaces.

ui-menuitem-icon.description: Required when using a <ui-menuitem nested> to indicate which item is selected. Should contain an icon or svg that indicates the selected state of the <ui-menuitem>.

ui-pagination.description: Pagination controls provide swift access to all pages while indicating that more pages exist.

ui-textfield.description: Text fields let users enter and edit text.

ui-textfield-helper.description: Styles the container of helper text and character counter elements.

ui-select-helper.description: Styles the container of helper text.

ui-checkbox.description: Checkboxes allow the user to select one or more items from a set. Checkboxes can be used to turn an option on or off.

ui-radio.description: Radio buttons allow the user to select one option from a set. Use radio buttons when the user needs to see all available options. If available options can be collapsed, consider using a dropdown menu because it uses less space.

ui-chips.description: Chips are compact elements that represent an input, attribute, or action.

ui-datepicker.description: Date pickers let users select a date, or a range of dates.

ui-switch.description: Switches toggle the state of a single item on or off. They are the preferred way to adjust settings on mobile.

ui-slider.description: Sliders allow users to make selections from a range of values.

ui-list.description: Lists are continuous, vertical indexes of text or images.

ui-item-text-content.description: Wrapper for list item text content (displayed as middle column of the list item).

ui-item-text1.description: Primary text for the list item. Should be the child of <ui-item-text-content>.

ui-item-text2.description: Secondary text for the list item. Displayed below the primary text. Should be the child of <ui-item-text-content>.

ui-item-first-content.description: The first tile in the row (in LTR languages, the first column of the list item). Typically an icon or image.

ui-item-last-content.description: The last tile in the row (in LTR languages, the last column of the list item). Typically small text, icon. or image.

ui-list-group.description: Wrapper around two or more <ui-list> elements to be grouped together.

ui-list-group-subheader.description: Heading text displayed above each list in a group.

ui-image-list.description: Image lists display a collection of images in an organized grid.

ui-image-item.description: Indicates each item in an Image List.

ui-image-text.description: Indicates the area within each item containing the supporting text label, if the Image List contains text labels.

ui-card.description: Cards contain content and actions about a single subject.

ui-card-content.description: The main tappable area of the card. Typically contains most (or all) card content except <ui-card-actions>. Only applicable to cards that have a primary action that the main surface should trigger.

ui-card-media.description: Media area that displays a custom `background-image` with `background-size: cover`.

ui-card-media-content.description: An absolutely-positioned box the same size as the media area, for displaying a title or icon on top of the `background-image`.

ui-card-actions.description: Row containing action buttons and/or icons.

ui-card-buttons.description: A group of action buttons, displayed on the left side of the card (in LTR), adjacent to <ui-card-icons>.

ui-card-icons.description: A group of supplemental action icons, displayed on the right side of the card (in LTR), adjacent to <ui-card-buttons>.

ui-table.description: Data tables display sets of data across rows and columns.

ui-collapse.description: A content area which can be collapsed and expanded.

ui-badge.description: Small status descriptors for UI components.

ui-alert.description: Alerts provide contextual feedback messages for typical user actions with the handful of available and flexible alert messages.

ui-dialog.description: Dialogs inform users about a task and can contain critical information, require decisions, or involve multiple tasks.

ui-dialog-title.description: Brief summary of the dialog's purpose.

ui-dialog-content.description: Primary content area. May contain a list, a form, or prose.

ui-dialog-actions.description: Footer area containing the dialog's action buttons.

ui-snackbar.description: Snackbars provide brief messages about app processes at the bottom of the screen.

ui-banner.description: A banner displays a prominent message and related optional actions.

ui-progress.description: Linear progress indicators display progress by animating an indicator along the length of a fixed, visible track. The behavior of the indicator is dependent on whether the progress of a process is known.

ui-spinner.description: Circular progress indicators display progress by animating an indicator along an invisible circular track in a clockwise direction. They can be applied directly to a surface, such as a button or card.

ui-tooltip.description: Tooltips display informative text when users hover over, focus on, or tap an element.
